EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be done by providing an official TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo score report. The English proficiency requirement may be waived for applicants who have completed a bachelor's or a master's degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution or a recognized university in a country where English is the official language.
Program name: Master of Education in Art Education

EnglishScore: Graduate applicants must demonstrate English proficiency by one of the following: A TOEFL score of 79 or higher on the internet-based test (iBT), an IELTS score of 6.5 or higher, a Duolingo English Test score of 105 or higher, a Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic score of 53 or higher, successful completion of the ELS Language Center's level 112, or graduation from a U.S. college or university or from a college or university in a country where English is the official language.
Program name: Art Education (Certification)

EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you will be required to submit proof of English proficiency. You may prove your proficiency by providing one of the following: TOEFL - a minimum score of 79 on the iBT (internet-based test) or 550 on the pBT (paper-based test). IELTS - a minimum score of 6.5. Duolingo - a minimum score of 105. Pearson (PTE) - a minimum score of 53. ELS Language Center - a level 112 certificate. Proof of a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited U.S. college or university.
Program name: Master of Fine Arts in Communication Design

EnglishScore: Proof of English Proficiency is required of all students whose first language is not English. Acceptable forms of proof include: TOEFL minimum score of 79 on the iBT, IELTS minimum score of 6.5, Duolingo minimum score of 100, or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Program name: Master of Education in Music Education

EnglishScore: Kutztown University requires all international students to provide proof of English Proficiency. This requirement can be fulfilled by ONE of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) score of 79 on the iBT (internet-based test). The institutional code for Kutztown University is 2362. IELTS (International English Language Testing System) band score of 6.5. Must be the academic version of the exam. Duolingo score of 105. ELS Language Center Level 112. Proof of having received a degree from a U.S. college or university. Proof of having received a degree from a foreign university where the language of instruction is English.
Program name: Music Education (Certification)

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be demonstrated by submitting a TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo score, or through other approved methods.
Program name: Master of Business Administration (MBA)

EnglishScore: International students whose native language is not English are required to provide proof of English proficiency by one of the following options: TOEFL (79 IBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (overall band score of 6.5), PTE Academic (score of 53), Duolingo English Test (score of 105), or ELS Language Center (Level 112 with a grade of B or higher).
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Business Decision-Making

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take an English proficiency exam. The following are the minimum scores required for admissions consideration: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) score of 79 (IBT) or 550 (PBT); IELTS (International English Language Testing System) score of 6.5; Duolingo score of 105; PTE Academic score of 53; ELS Language Center Level 112.
Program name: Master of Science in Computer Science

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following: TOEFL with a minimum score of 79 (iBT) or 550 (PBT); IELTS with a minimum score of 6.5; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105; Pearson PTE with a score of 53; or proof of completion of ELS Level 112.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Data Analytics (MBA)

EnglishScore: For international applicants, proof of English proficiency is required. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL - 79, IELTS - 6.5, Duolingo - 100, Pearson's Test of English (PTE) - 53, or successful completion of ELS level 112. Exemptions may apply for those who meet specific criteria, such as being a citizen of certain English-speaking countries or having a degree from a U.S. institution.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Leadership (MBA)

EnglishScore: All students for whom English is not their native language must demonstrate proficiency by providing one of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a minimum score of 79 on the iBT (internet-based test) or 550 on the PBT (paper-based test); IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with a minimum overall band score of 6.5; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic with a minimum score of 53; Successful completion of an ELS (English Language Service) language center program, level 112. The English language proficiency requirement may be waived for students who have earned a degree from a U.S. institution or a pre-approved country where English is the official language.
Program name: Master of Public Administration (MPA)

EnglishScore: All international applicants must demonstrate a satisfactory level of English proficiency. This is normally done by submitting official results of an English proficiency test such as TOEFL, IELTS, PTE Academic, or Duolingo English Test. The minimum acceptable scores for admission are: TOEFL - 79 (internet-based), IELTS - 6.0, PTE Academic - 53, and Duolingo English Test - 105.
Program name: Master of Education in Student Affairs in Higher Education

EnglishScore: All students for whom English is not their native language must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be met via TOEFL (minimum 79 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), Duolingo (minimum 105), PTE Academic (minimum 53), or completion of ELS Level 112. Other exemptions are available for students who completed coursework or high school in the US, or are from certain English-speaking countries.
Program name: Master of Arts in Addiction Counseling

EnglishScore: Official test results of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or International English Language Testing System (IELTS) is required for all students for whom English is not their first language. A minimum score of 550 on the paper-based test or 213 on the computer-based test or 79 on the internet-based test is required on the TOEFL for admission. A minimum score of 6.5 is required on the IELTS. Successful completion of level 112 in the English Language Services (ELS) program will be accepted in lieu of the TOEFL or IELTS.
Program name: Master of Arts in Clinical Mental Health Counseling

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take an English proficiency exam. Minimum scores accepted are: TOEFL score of 79 on the IBT (internet-based) exam, IELTS score of 6.5, Duolingo English Test score of 105, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic score of 53, or successful completion of the ELS Language Center's intensive Level 112.
Program name: Master of Arts in Marriage, Couple and Family Counseling

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) exam.
Program name: Master of Science in School Counseling

EnglishScore: Kutztown University requires a certain level of English proficiency for our international students. You can meet this requirement in one of the following ways: TOEFL: a minimum score of 79 (iBT) or 550 (pBT); IELTS: a minimum score of 6.5; Duolingo English Test: a minimum score of 100; Successful completion of the ELS Language Center's Level 112.
Program name: Autism (Endorsement Certification)

EnglishScore: All international applicants must demonstrate a satisfactory level of English proficiency. This can be met by providing an official score report from one of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a minimum score of 79 on the Internet-based version or 550 on the paper-based version; IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with a minimum band score of 6.5; Duolingo with a minimum score of 100; ELS (English Language Services) with successful completion of Level 112 of the ELS English Language program; or PTE Academic (Pearson Test of English) with a minimum score of 53.
Program name: Curriculum and Instruction (Supervisory Certificate)

EnglishScore: All international students are required to show proof of English language proficiency. Kutztown University will accept the following as proof of English proficiency: Duolingo score of 100 or higher, TOEFL iBT score of 79 or higher, IELTS score of 6.5 or higher, or successful completion of the ELS Language Center's level 112.
Program name: English as a Second Language (Certification)
Instructional Coach (Endorsement Certificate)

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to submit proof of English language proficiency. Kutztown University accepts the following: TOEFL: minimum 79 iBT, IELTS: minimum 6.5, DUOLINGO: minimum 100. Students who do not meet the English requirement may be considered for conditional admission through our ESL Pathways program. Waivers for this requirement are available on a case-by-case basis. If you graduated from a U.S. university or a university in one of the countries listed on the university's international admissions page, you may be eligible for a waiver.
Program name: Master of Education in Instructional Technology

EnglishScore: All international applicants who are non-native English speakers must submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted methods include TOEFL (79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.5), Duolingo (110), ELS (Level 112 certificate), or PTE (53). Proof is not required from applicants who hold a bachelor's or master's degree from a regionally accredited U.S. university or college.
Program name: Instructional Technology Specialist (Certification)

EnglishScore: All international applicants who are not native speakers of English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by providing an official score report for one of the following: TOEFL: 79 (Internet-Based Test), 550 (Paper-Based Test); IELTS: 6.5; Duolingo: 110; ELS: Completion of Level 112; Pearson (PTE): 53.
Program name: Master of Library Science (MLS)

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted methods include TOEFL with a minimum score of 79 (iBT) or 550 (PBT), IELTS with a minimum score of 6.5, Duolingo with a minimum score of 105, Pearson (PTE) with a minimum score of 53, or completion of ELS Language Center's level 112. Completion of a bachelor's or master's degree from an accredited U.S. institution of higher education also fulfills the requirement.
Program name: Master of Library Science (MLS) plus Initial Certification or Extension of Certification

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS) exam, Duolingo English Test, or PTE Academic. Successful completion of level 112 at an ELS Language Center is also accepted.
Program name: Master of Education in Multicultural Education

EnglishScore: Official results of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo English Test are required for applicants whose native language is not English. Minimum TOEFL score of 79 (IBT), IELTS score of 6.5, or Duolingo score of 100. Successful completion of level 112 at an ELS Language Center is also accepted. The requirement may be waived for students who have earned a bachelor's or master's degree from an accredited institution in the U.S., or for students from countries where English is the official language.
Program name: PreK-12 Principal (Certification)

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate proficiency in the English language. This can be met with a minimum score of 79 on the TOEFL iBT, 550 on the TOEFL PBT, 6.5 on the IELTS, 105 on the Duolingo English Test, 53 on the PTE, or by successfully completing ELS Level 112. This requirement may be waived for applicants who have earned a degree from a regionally accredited U.S. college or university or from a country where English is the official language.
Program name: Master of Education in Reading Specialist

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following: a minimum TOEFL score of 79 (iBT) or 550 (pBT), a minimum IELTS score of 6.5, a minimum Duolingo English Test score of 100, a minimum PTE Academic score of 53, or completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Program name: Reading Specialist (Certification)

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting official test scores from one of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a score of 79 or higher on the IBT (Internet-based Test), IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with a score of 6.5 or higher, Duolingo with a score of 110 or higher, or Completion of ELS Level 112. Applicants who have earned a bachelor's or master's degree from a regionally accredited U.S. college or university are not required to submit proof of English proficiency.
Program name: Master of Education in Secondary Education

EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you will need to provide proof of English proficiency. Kutztown University accepts the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) - minimum score 79 iBT, International English Language Testing System (IELTS) - minimum score 6.5, Duolingo - minimum score 100, ELS Language Center - successful completion of Level 112, or Pearson Test of English (PTE) - minimum score 53. Students who have earned a bachelor's or master's degree from an accredited institution of higher education in the United States, or from a country where English is the official language, are not required to submit an English proficiency score.
Program name: Secondary Education (M.Ed. plus Certification)

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting ONE of the following: A minimum score of 79 on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL iBT). We also accept MyBest Scores from TOEFL. A minimum overall band score of 6.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS). A minimum score of 105 on the Duolingo English Test. Completion of the ELS Language Center's level 112.
Program name: Special Education (Certification)

EnglishScore: All international applicants must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following: a TOEFL iBT score of 79, an IELTS score of 6.5, a Duolingo score of 100, a PTE score of 53, or completion of ELS Language Center Level 112. A waiver may be available for applicants who have completed a degree from an accredited U.S. institution or a country where English is the language of instruction.
Program name: Doctor of Education in Transformational Teaching and Learning (EdD)

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests include TOEFL (minimum 79 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), Duolingo (minimum 100), Pearson PTE (minimum 53), or completion of ELS Level 112 with a grade of B or higher.
Program name: Visual Impairment (Certification)

EnglishScore: English language proficiency may be demonstrated with an official transcript from a U.S. college or university with the completion of 24 transferrable credits, including English composition with a grade of 'C' or better or by submitting one of the following official scores: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) score of 79, IELTS (International English Language Testing System) score of 6.5, ELS (English Language Service) level 112, Duolingo English Test score of 105, or Pearson Test of English (PTE Academic) score of 53.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in School Social Work

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. The following are acceptable measures of English proficiency: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) - The minimum required score is 79 for the internet-based test (iBT), 213 for the computer-based test (CBT), or 550 for the paper-based test (PBT). IELTS (International English Language Testing System) - The minimum required score is 6.5. PTE Academic - The minimum required score is 53. Duolingo English Test - The minimum required score is 105. ELS - Completion of Level 112 of the ELS Language Centers' Intensive English Program.
Program name: Master of Social Work (MSW)

EnglishScore: All international applicants are required to provide proof of English proficiency by submitting ONE of the following: TOEFL: 79 iBT, IELTS: 6.5 band score, Duolingo English Test: 100, ELS Language Center: Level 112, Pearson (PTE Academic): 53, or successful completion of an approved ESL program.
Program name: Doctor of Social Work (DSW)

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to take an English proficiency exam. Kutztown University accepts the following exams: TOEFL, IELTS, and Duolingo. An official score report of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 79 on the internet-based test (iBT), or 550 on the paper-based test (pBT). An official score report from the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum overall band score of 6.5. An official Duolingo English Test score report with a minimum score of 105. Successful completion of the ELS Language Center's level 112.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Communication Design: Creative Catalyst

EnglishScore: For international students who have not completed their bachelor's or master's degree from a U.S. institution, proof of English proficiency is required. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT 79 or PBT 550, IELTS 6.5, PTE 53, Duolingo 105, or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Communication Design: Creative Futures

EnglishScore: The TOEFL or IELTS is required for international students whose native language is not English. Acceptable evidence of proficiency includes a minimum TOEFL score of 79 iBT, IELTS score of 6.5, Duolingo score of 105, PTE Academic score of 53, or completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Communication Design: Creative Refresh

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency. One of the following may be submitted to meet this requirement: TOEFL- Minimum score of 79 (internet-based), IELTS- Minimum score of 6.5, Duolingo- Minimum score of 100, ELS Level 112 Certificate, official transcripts from a U.S. college or university showing completion of a bachelor's or master's degree, or citizenship of an English-speaking country.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Computer Science: Data Analytics

EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting an official TOEFL or IELTS score report. TOEFL: minimum 79 iBT; IELTS: minimum 6.5. Completion of ELS Language Center's Level 112 with a 3.0 GPA is also accepted.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Computer Science: Database Design and Administration

EnglishScore: Graduate applicants who are not native speakers of English are required to demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by providing a TOEFL score of at least 79 (internet-based), an IELTS overall band score of 6.0, a Duolingo English Test score of 105, or successful completion of the ELS Language Center's level 112. A bachelor's or master's degree from a regionally accredited U.S. college or university or a recognized university in a country where English is the official language also fulfills this requirement.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Geography: Geospatial Information Technology
